text: Ananda Mohan Chakrabarty ( Ānandamōhan Cakrabartī; April 4, 1938 - July 10, 2020) was an Indian-American microbiologist and researcher. He was known for his work in directed evolution and his role in creating a genetically engineered organism using plasmid.US Patent 4,259,444 This led to landmark Supreme Court case, Diamond v. Chakrabarty.
